contents.text: I don’t know your name — I don’t have access to personal data unless you share it. Would you like to tell me what to call you, or should I use a neutral greeting (like “friend”)?
Nice to meet you, Bruno! How would you like me to address you—Bruno, a nickname, or something else? And any pronouns you prefer? How can I help today?
I live in Canada, near Toronto, I mean +80 KMs away from Toronto

Thanks, Bruno — good to know. I can remember that for this chat: you’re in Canada, about 80+ km from Toronto.

What would you like help with related to your location? A few things I can do:
- find travel/commute options and typical drive/transit times to Toronto  
- check local services (healthcare, schools, government)  
- look up weather, events, or housing/job market info  
- explain regional rules or resources

If you want tailored help, tell me the nearest town or postal code (or a direction from Toronto).
what else do you know about me?

From this chat I only know what you told me. Specifically:

- Your name: Bruno  
- You live in Canada, about 80+ km from Toronto  
- I said I could remember that for this chat

I do not know your age, job, pronouns, nickname, or other personal details unless you tell me them. I also don’t have access to outside personal data. If you want me to remember more details for this conversation, tell me and I will. What would you like me to remember or help with next?
